Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a six-lobed melon-shaped body, a long tubular nozzle, an oval rim round the wick-hole, and a plain rim round the filling-hole. The pierced handle is decorated on top with a double rib and has a rectangular panel at the rear. Between the top of the handle and the filling-hole are six short ribs. Most of the lamp is covered in a dark brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q583)
